newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius bourse up on foreign investor buying.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius bourse up on foreign investor buying.

text.p: The Mauritius bourse share index rose 2.85 points to 324.19 on Wednesday as some leading stocks rose on buying by foreign investors, brokers said.
Traded volume was provisionally posted at 8.05 million rupees on 260,094 shares from 4.04 million rupees on 81,541 shares on Monday.
The Mauritius bourse official market trades on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays.
"Foreign investors bought a little today, mostly blue chip stocks such as Mauritius Commercial Bank, State Bank of Mauritius and Mauritius Breweries," said an official of a leading brokerage house.

The rise in prices of these leading shares pushed up the share index (Semdex), bourse officials said. They added that a majority of volume was concentrated in these stocks while the rest of the market remained flat and attracted thin trading.
Mauritius Commercial Bank was unchanged at 73 rupees on 32,302 shares while State Bank of Mauritius gained 20 cents to 8.50 rupees on 135,000 shares.
Mauritius Breweries surged 5.0 rupees to 123 on 13,950 shares but Mauritius Oil Refineries shed 10 cents to 7.90 rupees on 2,592 shares.
Investment-based United Docks remained at 40.50 rupees on 2,110 shares and National Investment Trust (NIT) was stable at 12.50 rupees on 10,000 shares.
Sugar security Mon Tresor Mon Desert was unchanged at 31.50 rupees on 3,460 shares and Savannah (ordinary) was stable at 123 rupees on 2,247 shares.
Conglomerate Rogers remained at 94.50 rupees on 10,000 shares and New Mauritius Hotels was unchanged at 28 rupees on 10,000 shares.
Hotel concern Sun Resorts was stable at 36 rupees on 2,943 shares and national carrier Air Mauritius climbed 3 rupees to 55 on 9,570 shares.
